Legal_Issue: Whether the PRRA decision should be quashed due to procedural errors
Application_Facts: PRRA officer failed to apply the 'reasonable chance' test; concerns about objectivity at Niagara Falls office after two flawed decisions
Remedy_Requested: Quashing of PRRA decision and new assessment
Court_Ruling: Judicial review granted; new PRRA reconsideration ordered with conditions
Defendant_Behavior: Failure to follow proper legal standards in PRRA assessment
Grounds_for_Claim: Procedural errors, potential bias, failure to apply correct legal test
Assessment_Factor: Compliance with Canadian legal standards, objectivity of decision-maker
Procedural_Issue: Improper application of PRRA procedures, lack of adherence to legal standards
Credibility_Assessment: Credibility not challenged unless sanctioned by court; no basis for challenge here
Evidence_Used: History of flawed decisions at Niagara Falls office
Legal_Provision_Cited: PRRA assessment requirements under Canadian immigration law
Application_Basis: Risk of harm assessed under PRRA framework
Evidence_Assessed: Pattern of errors indicating systemic issues
Governing_Rule: PRRA must be conducted per legal standards without unsanctioned credibility challenges
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of proper legal reasoning in original decision
Outcome: Decision quashed, case referred back for reconsideration
Harm_Assessment: Risk of unfair denial of protection due to procedural flaws
Cause_Description: Improper PRRA assessment due to procedural errors and potential bias
Evidence_Handling: Failure to properly assess risk using required legal test
Legal_Provision_Violated: Requirements for fair and lawful PRRA assessment
Evidence_Issues: Insufficient justification, deviation from standard procedure
Legal_Provision: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) provisions on PRRA
Jurisdictional_Issue: Authority of Niagara Falls office to conduct lawful PRRA
Evidence_Assessment: Concerns over consistency and legality of prior decisions
Decision_Rationale: To ensure compliance with Canadian law and prevent repetition of errors
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of documented adherence to legal standards
Legal_Standard_Applied: Reasonable chance test for risk of persecution or harm
